Name: Designating expanded polystyrene as recyclable.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to designating expanded polystyrene as recyclable.
BodyName: Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management

History.Action: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
History.Description: This Introduction was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
History.BodyName: Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management

History.Action: P-C Item Laid Over by Comm
History.Description: This Introduction was P-C Item Laid Over by Comm
History.BodyName: Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
History.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Sanitation and Solid Waste Management

History.Description: This Introduction was Sine Die (Filed, End of Session)

Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

      Section 1. Subdivision b of section 16-305 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended to read as follows: 
      b. The commissioner shall adopt and implement rules designating at least six recyclable materials, including plastic, to the extent required in subdivision c of this section, expanded polystyrene or thermoplastic polymer foam comprised of at least 80 percent styrene or para-methylstyrene by weight, and yard waste to, the extent required in section 16-308 of this chapter, contained in department-managed solid waste and requiring households to source separate such designated materials. 
      ï¿½2. This local law shall take effect ninety days after its enactment. 
LS 4553
JJH
